item.description:
In May, we're going to do the National Tasting Project. We've done this in June in prior years.

Kim has generously volunteered to host the meeting at her place in Grafton.

This year it's a fun theme of Rhone-style wines from around the world.  So, we will have some from the Rhone in France, of course, but also from California and Australia.  I will take care of getting the wines for the meeting - selecting from a list provided by AWS.

This is one event where we get to practice our wine scoring and compare ourselves with the entire AWS - or at least the chapters that are participating.

As always, a great chance to try something new and learn something about wine while we have fun together!

Reporting the results is quite structured so that the AWS can import the data more or less directly and Noel has volunteered to help us with that.

I'm looking forward to another fun evening!

 

Charlie
item.name: AWS National Tasting Project
